load packages
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
```

source function for runoff estimates
```{r}
source(here::here("src", "storm_runoff.R"))
# create impervious fraction sequence
fraction_seq <- seq(from = 0.6, to = 0.8, by = 0.01)

# calculate runoff predictions with runoff function
runoff_prediction <- predict_runoff(seq_along(fraction_seq), 182)

# knit both into a data frame
runoff_volumes <- data.frame(impervious_fractions = fraction_seq, 
                             runoff_volume = runoff_prediction)
# create ggplot graph 
ggplot(data = runoff_volumes, aes(x = impervious_fractions, y = runoff_volume)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Stormwater Runoff Predictions",
       x = "Impervious Fractoins",
       y = "Volume of Stormwater Runoff (cubic feet)")

# save the plot as a png
ggsave(here::here("figs", "runoff_plot.png"))
```
